Uses of Package
engine.rendering

  • Packages that use engine.rendering 
    Package Description
    engine.components
    Provides various components that are useful in virtually any application.
    engine.core
    Classes defining the core functionality of the game engine.
    engine.core.entity
    Classes for defining the objects in the game and their functionality.
    engine.rendering
    Classes for rendering graphics.
    engine.rendering.opengl
    Classes for rendering graphics with OpenGL.
    engine.util.factory
    Classes to make creating objects easier.
    engine.util.menu
    Classes for creating and rendering a menu.
  • Classes in engine.rendering used by engine.components 
    Class and Description
    Color
    Represents a Color.
    IRenderContext
    Interface that specifies higher-level rendering functions for a rendering device.
    LightMap
    A texture storing lighting information.
    SpriteSheet
    A 2D sheet containing various sprites.
  • Classes in engine.rendering used by engine.core 
    Class and Description
    IDisplay
    Interface for a display system showing the game.
    IRenderContext
    Interface that specifies higher-level rendering functions for a rendering device.
  • Classes in engine.rendering used by engine.core.entity 
    Class and Description
    IRenderContext
    Interface that specifies higher-level rendering functions for a rendering device.
  • Classes in engine.rendering used by engine.rendering 
    Class and Description
    ArrayBitmap
    Stores images in an array of 32-bit ARGB pixels.
    ArrayBitmap.IVisitor
    Interface for visiting every pixel in an ArrayBitmap.
    Color
    Represents a Color.
    IRenderContext
    Interface that specifies higher-level rendering functions for a rendering device.
    IRenderDevice
    Interface for some piece of hardware, physical or virtual, that is capable of graphics rendering.
    IRenderDevice.BlendMode
    Specifies a way of blending graphics.
    LightMap
    A texture storing lighting information.
    RenderTarget
    Represents a location that can be rendered to by a particular IRenderDevice
    SpriteSheet
    A 2D sheet containing various sprites.
    Texture
    Represents a renderable texture.
